page.title: 01BAMFORD IN THE PEAK
page.content: SET IN THE HILLS 11 MILES N.E. OF BUXTON,THIS SMALL VILLAGE BOASTS A TALL SLIM CHURCH TOWER SURMOUNTED BY A SHARP SPIRE. THE COUNTRYSIDE AROUND THE VILLAGE ADDS TO ITS ATTRACTION. TO THE NORTH THERE ARE THREE LARGE RESERVOIRS LADYBOWER,DERWENT AND HOWDEN,SEPARATED BY MASSIVE DAMS UNDER WHOSE WATERS LIE TWO VILLAGES.ONE OF THE BEST DRIVES IS TO GO ALONG THE SHORES OF LADYBOWER AND ON TO THE FAMOUS SNAKE PASS WHICH LEADS OVER TO GLOSSOP. THE AREA IS A HAVEN FOR THE OUT DOOR TYPE WITH ACTIVITIES SUCH AS WALKING,CLIMBING,SAILING,HANG-GLIDING AND MANY OTHERS. THESE DAYS MOST OF THE VILLAGE POPULATION TRAVEL OUT TO THE LARGER TOWNS,SHEFFIELD IN PARTICULAR,TO WORK.
